inlineContent.text: Learn how to support receiving foreground and background push notifications.
Create and upload your Apple push notification file or certificate to Braze by following the steps in
capabilities by following the directions in
Add required capabilities to your application to support push notifications.

The Braze instance will automatically: register the application for remote notifications, register the Braze supported notification button categories, request for the push authorization at launch, implement the required system delegate methods for push processing (deviceToken, silent push, foreground push, etc.).
Enable automation for all push releated features.
Each automation step can be disabled or enabled on its own, see
type. In this step, we demonstrate how to disable the automatic request for push authorization at launch.
Your application can now receive and process foreground and background push notifications from Braze.
Configure the Braze instance to automatically provide full support for push notifications or parts of the integration.

method and pass the device token to Braze.
This enables support for silent / background remote notifications.

Get the current user notification center and set its notification categories using those provided by Braze.
This enables support for notifications with action buttons.
Set the delegate on the current user notification center.
